oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Assessing Herd Performance in Relation to Replacement Rearing
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Donovan, G. Arthur
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: replacement rearing
dairy herd performance evaluation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Replacement rearing involves most of the general herd health and production control programs instituted for the milking herd, i.e., nutrition, reproduction, disease control (vaccinations), ventilation, calving management, parasite control and even mastitis prevention, as well as more specific management areas such as colostrum management, pinkeye prevention and treatment of calf related diseases.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1985; 50-51
